FAQ
---

[### How do you choose the best pricing plan?](https://sendpulse.com/prices#accordion_faq_0)

SendPulse offers the following pricing plan options:

*   Monthly subscription: Free, Standard, Pro, and Enterprise (pricing plans differ based on the available features and mailing list size)
*   Pay as you go (pricing plans differ based on the available features and mailing list size. Purchased emails are valid for a year)

With the Free plan, you can send emails to up to 500 subscribers. To send emails to more users, choose one of our paid pricing plans based on the needs, size, and nature of your business.

Check our pricing page to find out more about our plans.

[### How do I switch to a different plan?](https://sendpulse.com/prices#accordion_faq_1)

To change your pricing plan, determine the features you need and the size of your mailing list and follow these steps:

1.  In your SendPulse account, go to the "Email" tab and select the "Pricing plans" section.
2.  Click "My subscriptions" and select a pricing plan.
3.  Click "Activate."

[### How can I pay?](https://sendpulse.com/prices#accordion_faq_2)

1.  In your SendPulse account, go to the "Email" tab and select the "Pricing plans" section.
2.  Select a pricing plan.

We accept Visa and Mastercard credit cards. You can also pay via PayPal.

[### What if I change my mind?](https://sendpulse.com/prices#accordion_faq_3)

To cancel pricing plan auto-renewal, follow these steps:

1.  In your SendPulse account, click the avatar in the upper-right corner and go to "Payments."
2.  Select a pricing plan you want to disable and click "Cancel subscription."

[### What is the difference between monthly subscription plans and pay-as-you-go plans?](https://sendpulse.com/prices#accordion_faq_4)

*   Monthly subscription plans are auto-renewable, meaning that you will be charged for your pricing plan each month from the moment you activate it;
*   Pay-as-you-go plans allow you to send a certain number of campaigns throughout the year. To send more emails, buy a pay-as-you-go plan again.

FAQ
---

[### How do you choose the best pricing plan?](https://sendpulse.com/pricing#accordion_faq_0)

SendPulse offers the following pricing plan options:

*   Monthly subscription: Free, Standard, Pro, and Enterprise (pricing plans differ based on the available features and mailing list size)
*   Pay as you go (pricing plans differ based on the available features and mailing list size. Purchased emails are valid for a year)

With the Free plan, you can send emails to up to 500 subscribers. To send emails to more users, choose one of our paid pricing plans based on the needs, size, and nature of your business.

Check our pricing page to find out more about our plans.

[### How do I switch to a different plan?](https://sendpulse.com/pricing#accordion_faq_1)

To change your pricing plan, determine the features you need and the size of your mailing list and follow these steps:

1.  In your SendPulse account, go to the "Email" tab and select the "Pricing plans" section.
2.  Click "My subscriptions" and select a pricing plan.
3.  Click "Activate."

[### How can I pay?](https://sendpulse.com/pricing#accordion_faq_2)

1.  In your SendPulse account, go to the "Email" tab and select the "Pricing plans" section.
2.  Select a pricing plan.

We accept Visa and Mastercard credit cards. You can also pay via PayPal.

[### What if I change my mind?](https://sendpulse.com/pricing#accordion_faq_3)

To cancel pricing plan auto-renewal, follow these steps:

1.  In your SendPulse account, click the avatar in the upper-right corner and go to "Payments."
2.  Select a pricing plan you want to disable and click "Cancel subscription."

[### What is the difference between monthly subscription plans and pay-as-you-go plans?](https://sendpulse.com/pricing#accordion_faq_4)

*   Monthly subscription plans are auto-renewable, meaning that you will be charged for your pricing plan each month from the moment you activate it;
*   Pay-as-you-go plans allow you to send a certain number of campaigns throughout the year. To send more emails, buy a pay-as-you-go plan again.
